isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3406B -1991 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION

svcproc.title: General System Components
svcproc.para: Electronic Control Module - The ECM (terminal A) receives 12V battery power from D3 (20 AMP) circuit breaker through the Run Relay (when activated) on circuits 97B/97AC/97AD.
The ECM (terminal C) also receives 12V battery power from D4 (20 AMP) circuit breaker through the Crank Relay (when activated) on circuit 97F to the ECM.
The ECM (terminal B) goes to the J7 ground.

The ECM sends low voltage signals (approximately 5 volts) to the Diagnostic Switch, Clutch Switch, Brake Switch, Cruise ON/OFF and Selector Switch, and other system switches and components. The components then ground at J7 as does the ECM.

Run Relay (156) - The Run Relay acts like a switch and when activated delivers 12 volt battery power from D3 (20 AMP) circuit breaker to: the yellow "Engine Warning" light, the ECM (terminal A), the speedometer/tachometer unit and the Throttle Position Sensor. The Run Relay is activated when the key switch is in the ON position (see
Kysor Engine Shutdown
with that system).

Crank Relay (155) - The Crank Relay acts like a switch and when activated ( while the starter motor is engaged the crank relay is activated) delivers 12 volt battery power from D4 (20 AMP) circuit breaker to the ECM (terminal C).

Yellow "Engine Warning" Light - The yellow "warning light" receives 12 volt battery power from D3 (20 AMP) circuit breaker through the Run Relay (when activated). The warning light is grounded through the ECM (terminal G). The ECM closes or opens the ground to turn the light on and off in response to engine conditions. See TROUBLESHOOTING.

Diagnostic On/Off Switch (149) - The Diagnostic On/Off switch receives a signal from the ECM (circuit 97S). When the switch is closed (ON position) circuit 97-GL/97-GM/11DL goes to Pin 5 (ground) at the Diagnostic Connector (137). Also, with the diagnostic on/off switch closed, circuit 97-GL/97-GH/97-GD/11-GG is grounded at J7 cab ground.
Diagnostic Connector (137) - The 8-pin Diagnostic Connector has five pins used as follows:

item.para: Pin (1), circuit 98A(+), is the positive connection through Data Link connector J11 to the ECM (terminal J).
Pin (2), circuit 98C(-), is the negative connection through Data Link connector J10 to the ECM (terminal H).

Pin (3), circuit 97DL, provides 12 volt battery power from D3 (20 AMP) circuit breaker. The current path from the circuit breaker is circuit 97C/97AR/97DM to a 5 AMP in-line fuse, then circuit 97DL to the Diagnostic Connector.

Pin (5), circuit 11DL, is a ground to J7 on circuits 11DL/97-GM/97-GL/97-GH/97-GD/11-GG. With the Diagnostic On/Off switch in the ON position, the ECM (terminal E) is also grounded on the same circuits.
Pin (8), circuit 97E, comes from the ECM (terminal F).
